comment: This class online was a pain. He didn't give much feedback, and there were a lot of trick questions on tests. The last two tests were easier than the first two. There were only 4 tests, 4 discussions, and 4 essays. Essays and discussions were easy, but the tests seemed random. He didn't provide notes or powerpoints, only video lectures.

Worst professor I have had in my educational career. Do NOT take this class online. EVER. I have always loved history, have always excelled in history. This professor does not teach at all. He sets his students up for failure by providing very little to no feedback. Non responsive to emails. Horrible experience.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: He is a very sweet old man. 3 tests & the 3rd is your final. He emailed us what would be on the tests. 27 questions & 1 essay question. HE DOES NOT WRITE ANYTHING DOWN OR DO POWERPOINTS SO MAKE SURE YOU WRITE DOWN EVERYTHING & EVERY PAGE # HE SAYS. This is coming from a person who struggles to study & pay attention in class. If I can do it, you can
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Slomovitz is the best professor ever! He is very interesting and relates a lot of personal stories to the class. Tests are multiple choice and there is no final. Attendance is mandatory. Easy class, great professor.

Great teacher. He's a pleasure to listen to. He uses techniques that help students relate historical events to something that they can understand--making it easier to learn the material. I hope to take Slomovitz for another class in the future. grades are simple. I studied minimally and I made a B.

GREAT. Buy the book and the highligher, show up to class and you will do fine. His stories are interesting and if you go and talk to him, he will help you out at the end of the semester with grades. He uses the book A LOT but also posts lectures online. His tests are multiple choice and he has an essay question, but tells you prior to the test.

Great professor, he is extremely helpful and will even help you study if you need it. You NEED the book because that's the only tool he uses to teach the course. Attendance isn't mandatory but if you want an extra 10 points on your final grade then you should probably show up everyday. An easy A if you put forth some effort. I would recommend

Class is not very difficult. I ended the class with a high B, an A is very possible though. Attendance is mandatory, it is roughly 10% of your final grade. Definitely buy the boo as it is used everyday, also bring a highlighter as he pretty much teaches directly from the book. 3 tests each 30% of grade and attendance which is 10%.

Overall, a good teacher and really enjoys history! Definitely buy the book cause it's used alot. Three multiple choice tests and attendence is mandatory. A pretty easy class if you take notes and pay attention.

Really good professor, helpful. Has 3 tests multiple choice.  Do buy book because you will need to highlight what is talked about in class.  He does provide study guides for his tests.  Great class highly recommended!!!!

Took the course online and loved the fact that he records his lectures for you to view them online.  It was like you were in an actual class which made the course more interesting. Tests were easy, you have to go all out for the discussion boards or he will deduct pts like crazy.  I would defintely recommend him.  Easy A!

The class is not hard, but is very tedious. You cant use phones, computers, or even talk without being called out (in front of 300 students). The first exam is intense, but he gives extra credit (2 points) and the following exams are easier. The worst part of this course is sitting through his lectures. He pushes his books alot, and is conservative

Buy the book/bring your highlighter/do the study guides and of course come to class. Nice guy and very knowledgeable and helpful. Not and easy A....hardest class this semester and its my only gen ed class but I fail at history. He tells you that you dont need to know specifics/dates but he is LYING.Grade is 3 tests (mult choice) and attendance.

Boring class. Extremely strict for a 200 person class. No phones/can't leave class early/mandatory attendance. 3 tests that are very specific. Do the study guides and you should be alright. Not an easy A.. but attainable. BUY THE BOOK.

4 week summer session: He encourages you to buy the book (which you should bc you use it alot) and all of his teahings come from. He knows this stuff very well and clearly teaches it. His test questions come straight from the notes and are pretty easy. Just be sure to study a day or two in advance and you'll get an A!

Great professor I took him in the summer He knows his stuff vey well Attendance is mandatory & you will use your book everyday! He shows videoclips from what you're currently learning to help you understand. There are 3 tests each worth 30 points. The other 10 come from your attendance which adds up to 100 so it's your choice on the grade you make!
he is a great professor!! make sure you attend class everyday and highlight stuff from the book  when he tells you to do so. His grading system is easy too. He is also funny

Highly recommended!! One of the best history professors at KSU. Buy the book, you will use it a lot! Three tests, questions are specific so pay attention to detail. Attendance is mandatory but you are rewarded for it in the end. Pay attention and take notes and this class is easy. Professor adds many personal stories which make the lectures better.
Dr. Slomo is one of the best teachers at KSU. He is interesting and funny and genuinely cares about his students! Loved this class!!!! Would def take again!

Great man and AWESOME teacher! Attendance mandatory, but rewarded later. Interesting lectures, video clips, and personal stories. Goofy sense of humor, but also strict when it comes to side-conversations in class. If you take good notes in class and complete the study guides, you will ace the tests! Definitely recommend!

Attendance is mandatory, which is extremely annoying, he calls you out if you get up to go to the bathroom, He repeats hisself, and has a voice that could put anyone to sleep. But if you can get past all that, then he is a good teacher and his 3 test are easy.

I have really enjoyed this teacher, I like the way he teaches history. He makes it interesting and tells many stories to go along with it. He also has a goofy-dry sense of humor which was good for many laughs. Attendance is mandatory. We also use the text book a lot. 2 tests & 1 final exam.
Easy A bring a redbull or a laptop and do your study guides.

I loved having Rabbi Slomovitz for US History! He makes the lectures interesting with personal stories/remarks and the occasional dry humor. Be advised- attendance IS mandatory and he does check. (but, 10 extra points are added for good attendance). Everything on the tests comes from the book, and he basically just paraphrases the book in lecture.

Rabbi Slomavitz was a great proff.. I hate history and I never dosed off in his class.. If you miss class and let him know your situation he'll def. understand. Allowed class to openly comment and he had over 200 students to deal with.. He doesn't give homework, so you def. need to study your butt of in order to get a good grade!! Highly recom...

Very boring, but very easy. Forced to come to class, which is unfortunate, but if you can manage to pay attention- do. Fill out his study guides from the book and look over it a couple times and you'll be golden on the tests. Attendance is 10 points on your grade too so if you can come, ALWAYS COME!

The MOST boring professor i have EVER had!! attendance is mandatory and he only gives three tests so dont screw up!!! dont believe what everyone else has said, he is a good guy but a BORING professor!!!!!! BE WARNED dont come to class tired!

Great Teacher! I never liked history but enjoyed his class. You have to sign a card everyday for attendace. There are only 3 test , all questions mutiple choice. Mostly for the book the couple others come from his side lectures. Overall awesome teacher!

you need to buy the text book, he takes his notes right from it. His tests aren't too bad, and he gives you study guides. You get an extra 10 points if you have perfect attendance. He says "by the way" a lot. It provided me with mild entertainment.
Do the study guides and study them and you'll get an A even if you slept through every class. Attendance is a part of your grade though.
Awesome! Attendance is mandatory, but you'll want to come to class-very engaging. 3 tests and attendance make your grade - take him!
Very easy. attendance is mandatory and as long as you come you can easily get an A
Super easy class with a nice teacher.  If you need an A, take this class.  If you want to learn history above a 9th grade level take someone else.
He is any extremely good teacher!!!! I would recommend him to anyone. Very helpful!!!!!
Great teacher!  Super easy class.  Attendance is mandatory.  He tells a lot of jokes and stories which keep things interesting.  Tests were straight from book/lectures--super easy!

dr slomovitz is like the rambo of history teachers. he's a rabbi, was in the navy and wrote wrote a book. he's very knowledgeable and does tend to read from the book, but the portions he reads are what he expands on and that's exactly what's on the test. class is always interesting. great stories. i loved this class, i'm upset he doesn't have more.

Wonderful class. Tests were not hard if you attend lectures and briefly read over chapter highlights. Grades nicely on paper. Really enjoyed the current events in the beginning of class. I felt as if he kept most of his politics to himself. Thoroughly enjoyed the class. Made me think of many things I had not thought of before.

This guy is a joke. Takes roll each class for 20 minutes, reads line by line from the book, asks stupid questions and when nobody answers just calls random names, doesn't care about actually teaching. If you are freshmen you might like this class. If you take it as a senior, you will want to shoot yourself in the foot so you can skip it...
Take Dr.Slomovitz class ONLY if you will go to every class and you like history.

Easy to understand, easy material. I literally learned more in my high school history class. His research paper is really nothing more than an essay where he becomes easily stumped on words you know that he doesn't. He's also prone to insert his political opinions every 10 minutes so beware. If you want an A and have no dignity then have at it.

I wish I could have this teacher for every history class. He is amazing! Very animated, very engaging and the tests are extremely easy as long as you attend class and brief over the chapters. Dr. Slomovitz rocks!
Great

He takes attendance, so you have to come to class. However, if you do you will probably make an A. His tests are over exactly what he says in class, and he takes it almost completely out of the book. You don't have to read the whole book though... he tells you what to highlight and learn during class. I don't like history, but this class was good.
He is very good! his test is very easy and the essays too! I love his class it is very interesting! I will recommend him to everyone. Exellent professor.
His grading scale is REALLY messed up but it doesn't take away from him class at all. You have to come to class and tests come directly from notes in the book.

he is the best teacher ever had at college. very easy no takin notes books are already highlighted just listen to him in class, tells what is exactly  on the test and essay topics in advance so you know what ur gona hav test are made for the 4th grader very hard to fail the class
No Comments
I loved this class even though I wsan't very into history.  He is a great professor and makes things interesting.  He is very clear with what is on tests and he's a great guy!
FABULOUS teacher!! Learned a lot and he made things interesting!
Great teacher with a lot of experience and very funny voices.  Note: He has a semi-monotone voice.
